alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Pulaski (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 11:58AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Pulaski, Alexander, southeastern Scott, north central New Madrid and east central Stoddard Counties through 1245 PM CDT... At 1158 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Morehouse, or near Sikeston, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Miner around 1205 PM CDT. Morley and Hay-Wood City around 1210 PM CDT. Benton around 1215 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Mounds, Olive Branch, Horseshoe Lake Conservation Area and Tamms. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 6 and 21. Interstate 57 in Missouri near Mile Marker 1. Interstate 55 between Mile Markers 65 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for southern Illinois...and southeastern Missouri.
